page.title: 06LEISURE.Trosley.Warden.
page.content:
.are man made problems too, such as vandalism, graffiti and littering.
WILDLIFE,TREES and PLANTS.
The most common trees are beech,oak,ash,horse chestnut,sweet chestnut,elderberry,hornbeam,silver birch and yew.The oldest trees ,mainly beech,are 250 to 300 years old.a few trees in the park have been pollarded and many trees have been coppiced.Pollarding is when half the tree is cut down and several thin branches sprout out.A coppiced tree is cut right down and several thin branches also sprout out.The warden coppices some trees to give others more room to grow.In the past the branches were used for fencing and hop poles.
